title: Teaching Method Practical Competency Enhancement: Flipped Learning-Based Ophthalmology Education Program

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and human anatomy
context.additional_context: Competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can identify key symptoms and diagnostic methods of eye diseases with over 80% accuracy in a flipped learning environment

Learners will analyze three ophthalmology clinical cases through team-based problem-solving activities (four or more sessions) during a 2–4 week intermediate course. They will apply communication skills that meet at least two of three critical thinking assessment rubric criteria (evidence-based reasoning, alternative evaluation, logical consistency) and at least three of four peer evaluation standards (active listening, clear explanation, collaborative attitude).
Learners improve their ability to set learning goals and develop problem-solving strategies by 30% compared to pre-assessment through self-directed learning

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
